intro: Marsdenia weddellii, commonly known as the Weddell's Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweed and other similar plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of small, fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. The fruit is a follicle that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
